data.title: Business lunch
data.text: You definitely feel like you step into the past going to this place.  They have a very good selection of meats with lots of comfort food type sides.  Fast friendly service

data.title: Steak house
data.text: I used to eat lunch here all the time until the raised the prices 3 plus dollars on a steak  I can see a price increase but that's way out of line I won't be back the steaks are always good but the price is a joke

data.title: "Low End" steak house.
data.text: Had dinner at Spunky Steer with friends the other night.  We drove in from the desert and didn't think the experience was worth the drive.  The steak was inexpensive, but a little tough and tasteless.  very busy, loud place with no atmosphere.  Won't return

data.title: Best steaks not off our grill
data.text: Tony's is a local place we like to go to when we don't feel like cooking and we don't want to fight traffic to go anywhere. My husband LOVES the bacon wrapped Filet Minions and I like the New York Strip. They come out on metal platters sizzling from the grill. It has a homey atmosphere and the service is excellent.

data.title: great value, great taste
data.text: good honest steak place, great for families. Great flavor, great value. Everything on the menu is good

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Spunky steer is my favorite place. The steaks are juicy and tender the baked potatoes are huge garlic bread yum the chocolate shakes are to die for

data.title: Not a steakhouse worthy steak
data.text: I don't necessarily mind eating a cheap steak, as long as I'm not paying steakhouse prices for it. While the service was friendly and attentive, the facilities clean, the ribeye steak I had was just awful. It was thin and gristly, over seasoned, and just sad. My husband, on the other hand, ordered a rack of ribs that were pretty tasty, even if the sauce was overly sweet. Also on the plus side, the baked potato was thoroughly cooked. I had never heard of butter sauce (a mixture of butter and margarine) and I wasn't a fan, but at least the potato was fluffy and edible. Tony's should only be charging 9.99 for that steak, though. And am I the only one who thinks the name is an oxymoron?

data.title: Good food
data.text:
I met some friends for lunch,my first time here...I only ordered a Steak Sanwhich 
With grilled I onions with melt cheese...oh boy,it was delious,.the portion was perfect
The steak was cooked to my liking..my friends ordered the chicken fried steak..
Omg that was huge,and the baked potato was huge,..now this was a Texas Size
Portions..lol..I recommend

data.title: Old place with same menu
data.text: This restaurant is the same as it was the day it opened. The menu has lots of items and the portions are always large and the food is O K, but nothing exciting. If what you want is a hamburger, salad or big sandwich then its O K  The food is certainly not for anyone trying to watch their weight. If you are not concerned about that then their French Dip sandwich with french fries is great.

data.title: What's All the Hubub?
data.text:
Friends recommended this place, so I drove down from my hotel in a Highland to see what all the excitement was about.

I had a ribeye steak that was so-so.  Steaks should not be allowed to be cooked on a flat grill.  The shrimp cocktail was tasty and fresh.  But, I must say their loaded bake potato was awesome.

It's not a bad place; the service was good.  I just think it needs to be updated a bit.

data.title: Steaks and More
data.text: Low lighting, plenty of large comfortable booths but not necessarily a quiet, intimate place to enjoy a fairly-priced steak dinner.  Husband enjoys the liver & onions and their house steak served with your choice of steak fries or baked potato.  We've always thought the food good, portions generous and prices reasonable.  Plus the servers have always been efficient and friendly. The menu offers many types of sandwiches, a few salads and a fairly nice selection of dinners with steaks (naturally) their speciality.  Lower your expectations just a tad and enjoy!

data.title: service
data.text: went to this restaurant on 03/28/2014 and the service was the worst i have ever had at this restaurant i have been going there for 20 years just talked to the manager on the phone and was told if i did not like his restaurant not to come back he was very rude and did not want to here any complaints

data.title: Cheap Quality Steak
data.text: This is a very nice family venue.  The service is good, its clean, the portions are large, and it quality food.  Let's be honest this is a wonderful place that you are paying $16 for a 16 oz T-bone.  Don't expect a high end steak house but rather a family friendly restaurant that servers your weekly dinning needs.

data.title: Great prices decent meat.
data.text: I have always had good experiences here. Friendly staff and great prices. For the price you cannot get a much better piece of meat.... I have had lesser meat at many more expensive restaurants. Its not fancy just a great place to take a family and get a decent meal.

data.title: Very Welcoming
data.text: When I moved to Jurupa Valley area in April, I came across this restaurant.  It is wonderful!  The steaks are always cooked appropriately; the presentation is nice; the employees are friendly. The prices are comparable to other steak houses. We now come here approximately twice monthly.

data.title: Great, old fashioned place
data.text: Good food in an old 70's style restaurant. Steaks are pretty good and come out sizzling, a la Ruth's. Good sized portions and the staff is always friendly. Not gourmet, just good.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text:
I use to love the food here. The Stockyard was a favorite of mine. However, after the miserable experience I had tonight I will never go back. We get seated right away which was good, the busser took our drink order and the drinks came back and the way he served them the drinks were all over the place on the table. The waitress did the same thing with the refills and never once offered to clear the mess. My potato came out with cheese on it and the cheese was spilling onto my steak, problem was I didn't order cheese. I sent it back and got the cheese scooped out of the potato but when my plate came back the cheese was still on the steak. It was nasty nacho cheese on my steak, so I asked the waitress to get me a new steak, not an unreasonable request since I want steak sauce on my steak not cheese. Well I got extreme attitude so at that point we decided we were done there and would not be eating. 

I go to the front to complain, not only about the cheese but mostly about the nasty attitude Danielle the waitress gave me for not just accepting my cheese steak and asking for a new one. Instead of getting a chance to voice my annoyance I get the cashier charge me $6.47 for my drinks! The same drinks that were spilled all over the table by the busser and waitress. So we pay for our drinks and leave. I call later and ask for the manager. The same cashier said that they were working the floor and couldn't take my call. 

So I'm out $6.47 and have a ruined night because I didn't accept the nasty food that was sent to my table! I've been coming here since I was a kid when we lived in Mira Loma and this was called Steer and Stein but I will never, ever, ever come back.

data.title: Don't Bother
data.text: Looked and smelled great, no flavor, dry meat. Says I have to do 50 characters...do you all really want the review to get worse?

data.title: Best cow in the country
data.text: Best tasting steak anywhere in the area. Always fast service. If on the rare chance there is something wrong with your food they are not happy until you are. I love a good steak but I'm willing to split the plank steak with my wife and I still leave felling full. The price is also great.

data.title: Great value
data.text: Very nicely prepared steak with salad and baked potato for $10. You can't beat that. My wife had cod and liked it too. Nice atmosphere, friendly staff. We will go again tonight.
